author: {'steamid': '76561198841972298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1699417679}
review:
[b] Por el momento le doy un 10/10 [/b]
[b] Es una mezcla entre Animal crossing y PokÃ©mon. [/b]

 EmpezÃ¡s en una isla desde cero, en donde te dan a elegir un animalito llamado "Ooblet", cada Ooblet tiene sus habilidades y al igual que Pokemon podÃ©s coleccionarlos y pelear con otros, pero en este caso para atraparlos tenes que desafiar a los animalitos a un baile en el cual aparecen unas cartas con las habilidades de estos (Los bailes se juegan por turnos), al ganar el baile cada Ooblet sube de experiencia y asÃ­ es como obtiene nuevas habilidades, ademas de que el oponente te otorga su semilla para que al cultivarlo puedas tener esa especie a tu disposiciÃ³n.

 Hay misiones principales como tambiÃ©n secretas o de evento y podes mejorar la relaciÃ³n con cada habitante, visualmente es muy adorable y no hay forma de que te estreses ni aunque pierdas un baile ya que no hay castigo, al perder simplemente no obtendrÃ­as la semilla del oponente.

 Personalmente creo que si te gusta la onda de Animal crossing, PokÃ©mon o Slime rancher, tendrÃ­as que darle una oportunidad a Ooblets.

[h2] ActualizaciÃ³n de reseÃ±a [/h2]
 TambiÃ©n podÃ©s abrir tu propia tienda en donde se podrÃ¡ negociar para que el producto que vendas sea mas valioso (si abrÃ­s la tienda tenes que quedarte ahÃ­ hasta que la cierres). Ademas hay una zona en donde hay 6 arcades y te dan unos boletos, al tener muchos puntos podÃ©s canjearlo por cosas variadas.
AÃºn me falta desbloquear mÃ¡s zonas, pero por el momento se nota que al juego lo hicieron con mucho amor, es super completo, yo creo que lo vale incluso sin descuento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170976742', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1702153861}
review:
I have been playing this almost non-stop for the past couple of days and I have never been more happy with a purchase. 

- Yes, the language is different. Almost child-like, but when you think about it they call things as they are. Literally.
- Yes, the graphics are bright and colorful. Everything just pops!
- I love how easy it is to edit and craft things. Even the farming is made easier.
- Who doesn't love collecting so many different things? Ooblets, badges, friendship stickers, etc.

This game is super kid friendly, doesn't push romance in your face, and is super easy to play. The dancing instead of fighting was a brilliant idea! The music makes you want to dance with them and there are so many things to do and see. I can't wait to unlock more areas and get the few missing holiday stuff I am missing.

You guys are doing great!

The only suggestion I could offer is one you all are already working on and that's what to do with repeat ooblets. It would be nice to maybe send them to Ooblet safe haven or something so you only have to keep the ones you want. The wildlife is a good idea, but I'd really like to just collect one of everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119309685', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1701496536}
review:
HOWDO AND DAILYDO, this is the game for you!!!! 

You: I love the low pressure farming, resource/time management, and relationship building.

Me: OOBLETS HAS GOT THAT.

---

You: I love the aspects of Pokemon with training and leveling, having them follow me around, and collecting them. I just wish they didn't have to fight to train, and I could give them cute outfits.

ME: Ooblets is about THE DANCING. The only conflict is the cold, hard fighting for your life on the dance floor. (And how many cool hats you can fit in your pockets.)

---

You: Hearthstone is fun, I just wish there were similar options that weren't about Warcraft.

Me: What if Hearthstone was about a little mushroom lad, his tree stump friend, and long legged meatball neighbor having a sick dance off? That's Ooblets!!

---

You: ACNH Is great and all, I want other games to do that, same for seasonal stuff.

Me: Decor!! Fashion!! Ooblet dress up!! Collecting little trinkets for display!! Halloween events and more!! Oob Island has got it!!!

---

You: I like a little mystery--

Me, covering your mouth: You shut up before Meed hears you. Just buy your seeds from her and move along.

You: But I found this--

Me: Buy your seeds!!!

---

You: *silence*

Me: It has fishing. Per game laws, a game isn't good unless it has a fishing mechanic. But it does, soooooo....

---

In all seriousness, Ooblets is a fantastic game. My boyfriend gifted it to me, and I knew I was going to like it, but I didn't realize *how* much. I've only played 8 hours and if anything happens to this game or Gumberland, the developers, I'm gonna dance fight EVERYONE ON THE PLANET, and then myself. Personally, even at base price, this is worth every single penny, and I personally would have spent more on it than $30. The effort, love, and care that went into this game and the experiences it gives are SO WILDLY EVIDENT, it's amazing and insane. I'l be obsessed with this game forever, and one day I will own a plush of every single Ooblet. Every single one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069341647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1697858971}
review:
Without the fiasco.

Game is very bland. Graphic wise, it's very bland and everything shares almost if not all the same animations. 
Physics is very weird and off putting. Everything just clips together, like clothing, tools, ect.
Heck, even the chest slots is off, like someone just did a badly paste the slots into the less common (or 26 slots chest)
Ooblets are cute I guess, but that's it. there's not much variations to it.
While game is inspired by SoS(HM)/SDV/Pokemon, it barely touches the water or to into detail of what defines the genre.
I love farming games and grew up with SoS(HM)/RF/Pokemon/Sims. And it's safe to say that Ooblets has none of the features, or any features that make it stand out or unique on its own.
Farming is barebones, no seasons, no levels, same crops all the way. Also how farming grid is, it's also very clunky and not fun to farm.
Ooblets/Pokemon-- none, there's no stats and the only thing is the earning exp for level and maybe moves (cards) level up, and I guess you can dress them up a bit.
And Ooblets spawn per map is limited per day, they don't respawn until the next day.
There's no days or seasons, or seasonal events (not real life events). 
Dance battles is very repetitive and it's pretty much the same animations over and over. and the cards are RNG. They definitely should change the description of the game, as claiming you can "train" ooblets is a false advertisement.
One of the main thing that irks me, the crappy "baby" or terrible adventure time wannabe talk. And that's in the whole.game. there's not one remotely "normal" npc in game without the childish, overuse language.
There's a difference in making a unique NPC with their own unique slang/catchphrase vs making every npc sounds outlandishly and ridiculously childish. Also the game treats the player the same way, when you pick up new items/level up/rewards/ect. The naming of items are definitely babystyle also.
The game fails to blend in the sillyness, when they make the player have a set personality already. which also makes the set-player-response seemed like the player is the only sane one while the rest seems like they never graduated from kindergarten.
All the areas aside from Badgetown, are extremely lackluster and empty. If the area is lucky, the NPC gets houses (that you can't enter). There's no reason to return back to them unless you want to get ooblets or ooblet. No special NPC or townsfolk that you can build relationship with. It's hilarious how some npcs said the area is a town, such as nullwhere or pantsahill, when there's really nothing there. There's definitely no "townies" there as the plot claimed to be.
For the end plot, it's laughable how the game magically gets 100 votes when there's barely ANY living npcs.
Maps aren't fleshed out and not even half finish.
Townies NPC- no special feature or personality, they're very flat, no special events for friendship. You can college some bland stickers for friendship level I guess. 
Would not recommend.
If I wanted to collect 'pokemons' type, there's re;legends or sunhaven. As much as I have a love-hate feelings towards those two, they're a tons better than ooblets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087358711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1697196983}
review:
So I have over 165 hours on my Switch from this game, so this isn't my first rodeo with this.

It's a fun game, cozy and while the story is short, I do still enjoy playing it on my switch.

Please ignore all the crybabies in the forums; the drama was 4 years ago and if you're still mad about it, then you really need to recheck your priorities. Take no notice of them shaming others for buying the game; do what you want. I find this game enjoyable, I don't give two hoots what the devs did 4 years ago, it's the past for a reason. 

I recommend this game if you like cozy, farming type games, it definitely keeps you entertained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167590085', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1697938231}
review: I loved this game when I played it on Switch and I love it on here, too. It's such a fun, chill game. The music is great, the Ooblets themselves are so cute, I even love the dorky dialogue. It makes me giggle. This is actually the low, stress-relieving farming game that I always wanted. Stardew, Story of Seasons, original Harvest Moon, Rune Factory, they all stress me out beyond belief. I adore them but they are not cozy at all for me. Ooblets? Complete chill time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053631685', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1697001109}
review:
Why the hell is there a stamina meter for running in a game like this??? Your character walks like a glacial snail caught in molasses. You're forced to walk god awful slow until the meter recharges in a fkg cozy game. Limiting run speed doesn't make a game relaxing! What horrible game design. 

And on top of that, the game is buggy.  Some items, you try to interact with and it does nothing. No pop up, no reaction, no response.  The game randomly minimizes when playing with controller.

Maybe I'll go brain dead one day and give this game a try again.

review: would pay big money for a dlc with more ooblets, great game! it's hard to really compare it to anything because it has a lot of unique features (compared to other games i've played at least), it definitely stands out on its own. the dance battles instead of traditional random encounters is a fun gimmick, the necessary items needed to do dance battles reminds me of viva pinata somewhat (in a good way). a lot of times the games ive seen that fall into this genre (monster catching) tend to try way too hard to be pokemon and the designs just look like knockoff pokemon designs, but that's not the case here. i love how cute all the ooblets are. i would have loved the ability to customize the face more, even if it would just be to change eyebrows, nose shapes, or facial expressions. great game, people should definitely try it out while it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075521172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2677, 'last_played': 1698115509}
review:
TLDR I'd give this game a 7/10, its just good enough to hold your attention, but nothing ground breaking.

This games pretty nice and chill. There's farming, and critter collecting in the form of these ooblets. There's a good variety of both, though some of the ooblets look a little silly to me. There's crafting, and cooking, but neither are overly challenging. There story of the game doesn't take itself to seriously, and is manly a bunch of fetch quests. The style of this game is where it hits a major cord with me, and others games, like this one, should take a few notes. The clothes and furniture are so cute how they are styled, but there i will say, I WISH THERE WAS MORE, the catalog is pretty slim and could use some more color swatches of what they already have plus some more pieces. What they have is wonderful, and i love it, just sucks when you have a color of something your looking for, only to find it doesn't exist...... 
something i did not enjoy was a part of the game where is has you play mini games to get through it. This was only in one area and is not how the rest of the game functions. Anyways The mini games.... i hate them...i'm sorry i don't play a game, just to have to stop what i'm doing to play a shit version of flappy bird, and there are many games of that type along with it, but please if i want to play that sort of stuff, ill go download an arcade game....., Luckily the game has a bit of a buy around, so you don't have to play the games, but i saw they are using it as a selling point, like get outta here, they are not "fun". Sorry just thinks its silly. 
 anyways thanks for reading 
-ano

author: {'steamid': '76561198037376636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1700628033}
review:
I adore this game so much. This is the third time I've bought it actually! AND it's the best version I've played so far. The first release was great but the launcher gave me problems. The switch port was great but the loading times were soooo bad. But this one? This one is fast, loads quick, and I've yet to have a crash. Most stable version I've played so far tbh.

As for the reason I bought it three separate times? Well. There's so much variety in how you can customize your team, your clothes, your farm, and your house. And you can accessorize your ooblets! There's so many little things I can do every in-game day, which is a good length and never feels punishing. Does it take a bit to get the ball rolling on progress? Of course! But that's actually a good thing, as it lets you really feel out your place in this world.

The dance battles are the right level of challenging, and you can save by quitting to the main menu before one if you really want to retry. The mechanics developing over time and the various ooblets of the different regions having wildly different movesets really makes you have to strategize how best to face them, reworking what doesn't work and keeping what does. It's so easy to learn the more nuanced techniques, and once you get a good team going it's a real treat.

Off to sink another 200+ hours into this game once again. Amazing job, Glumberland, and thanks for patching bugs so quickly!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055329961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1687, 'last_played': 1696966960}
review:
**Fun, but shallow**

The game is solid and has its charm, but don't buy it looking for the next Stardew Valley.

The main character here is the world, which is charmingly oddball. The characters, on the other hand, are pretty basic. Yes, they have different personalities, but there's very little depth, just one-liners, and the friendship mechanic is pretty bare-bones (no progression, no personality changes, no reacting to the things you do, no romance mechanic).

The main activity here is collecting and battling ooblets. Farming is a thing you do so you can make recipes to unlock new ooblets; it works well, but it's a background system. Combat is easy - I won about 98% of my battles, and very few of them were tactically challenging. I never felt the need to switch Ooblets outside of my core 6 or so to beat opponents.

There is a story, and you can complete it and 100% the achievements in around 25 hours. There are no badges/achievements for collecting all the ooblets, so if that's what you're after, it'll take longer than 25 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993893677', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1702096206}
review:
It's cute and we're enjoying it but it's definitely not a strong contender nor an innovator in the genre. It's missing some features here and there that I'd personally like, dancing is not a good substitute for battling or combat as it simply isn't challenging - ever - and requires no consideration. Just play the cards and win.


On the non-dancing side of things I've found myself blasting through dialogue as fast as possible because nobody has anything interesting to say to me and nobody requires anything either. Every quest is a very simple collectathon, and leveling up relationship with other people is just a matter of speaking to them. Unfortunately, the characters all speak in a sort of pseudo-baby-speech that makes actually reading their dialogue cute at first and then infuriating later. 

On the whole I think it's cute and cozy, I like the simple satisfaction of collecting the ooblets and dancing to procure more of them, but the lack of complexity in this game leaves me wanting for so much more. In the end I'll probably tire of it and return to Stardew, and I'm sure other farming / life sim enjoyers have similar gripes about the total lack of emotional investment in this sickly-sweet world that is never playing itself straight with you.

review: I had this game on Switch for over a year and loved it. The moment I heard it was getting a PC port, I knew I'd have to set money aside to get it - and boy, am I glad I did. To me, it feels like it's so much easier to play on PC. The port is going great so far, minus the small, occasional bugs here and there, but I know how responsive the devs of this game are to fixing these issues so I'm not worried about them. I love this game so much and I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys calm, relaxing games with cute characters.

So if you're looking for a fun and relaxing game, look no further than Ooblets - it's a great game with no problems that I have seen during my 7-hour playtime! eat game that I would highly recommend to anyone who wants to have a fun and relaxing time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070597937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1697564344}
review:
I've had this game on my wishlist for a while, so when it launched on Steam, I got notified and decided to buy it on a whim.

As others have noted, there may be some balancing issues with the game, but that may also be a matter of play style and taste, so I'll leave those out (I'll say that I am frustrated that it feels like my progress is halted by my inability to do what the game wants me to do and I just don't know what it wants me to do).

The biggest issues I have with the game have to do with controls and menus. I play with keyboard and mouse, and the game is very inconsistent on when it allows you to use the keyboard and when you have no choice but to click a button with your mouse instead. There are also a lot of simple but annoying UX issues with the menus. For example if you've clicked on an ooblet, you can't click on another ooblet without going through deselecting the current ooblet. Sometimes just tapping space will get you out of menus, but sometimes you have to reach for escape. I've tried rebinding esc to control, but every time I restart the game it will forget my rebinding. You can't rebind keys to mouse buttons. Disabled buttons in menus are sometimes selected by default, so you have to manually switch to a non-disabled button to leave a menu. Other times you actually can not leave a menu using escape, but instead have to do something else to get out. I could go on.

This, combined with the balancing issues and flat out bugs, like getting out of bounds just by walking through a door (which was fun to be honest, but still a bug), at first made me think "ah, that's fine, these are just launch issues, I'm sure they'll be ironed out".

But of course I had forgotten that this game has been out for a year already as an Epic Games exclusive.

While I didn't know and don't care about the drama, the fact that the game has been out for a year does make me less hopeful that the gameplay will improve much from the current state.

Either way, I try to justify not refunding by supporting indies and more calm games in general. So with that, I hope the best for the devs as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011920508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1705038591}
review: There are other comfy games out there, but this one scratches a weird itch of mine. Not bad at all and got me to forget what time was for the first 10 hours of owning it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034073969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1697256075}
review: Ooblets!!! Its so wonderfully weird!  Some people have commented that they didn't like the dialog, I rather enjoy it and I think it really helps with the world building here.  Some conversations in the game actually made me laugh.  The whole game is quirky and wholesome and I am here for it.  I am emotionally attached to every ooblet I have gotten so far, and LOVE that the Halloween event you can get little costumes for them too!  There is a TON that this game does well.  If I had to complain about anything, its I wish you could set the difficulty on the card battles.  I think they are rather easy, and would like a little more of a challenge.  But I am fairly early in the game still, so maybe that changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561199217591708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1706137411}
review: Very fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198976217587', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1705186956}
review: PLAY THIS SILLY LITTLE GAME. NOW. It will keep you entertained for hours. Been waiting for the steam release of this game for YEARS. LITERAL YEARS of following this game. The easiest way I can describe it for you if you have 0 clue about the game is stardew valley and dance battling cute little thingymabobs. Each ooblet has 3 versions to collect, basically a shiny version like a pokemon and a super rainbow shiny version called a gleamy!!I love it, I love dance battling silly little guys and got my favourite gleamy ooblet in the entire game on my first day of playing. Luckily this game released on steam a day after my birthday, so thank you for the lovely birthday present ooblets team and my friend for buying it for me <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198026827893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1697585643}
review:
Ooblets is a charming, wholesome game that is relaxing to play.
Despite being so whimsical, it doesn't hand you information readily, and there's some good trial-and-error experiences to discover strategies both for battling and farming / making money (Gummies). Having a great time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105848891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1704934906}
review: 30mins of playing this game I just knew I would love it!! I loved it so much that I played 7hrs of it right off the bat!!! It's collecting , farming, cute and just flat out HAPPY. I'm addicted and trying to rush off of this review so I can play some more LOL :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199008196678', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1702410632}
review:
This game was already released on Epic and Switch, however, for others like me who do not use Epic Games this was the first chance to try the game. I heard a lot about it and the way I can sum this game up is 'Pokemon x Farming'. In this game you move to a new town, farm, collect ooblets and battle other ooblets by dancing! The premise is really cute and there is a LOT of ooblets to collect which I imagine can take ages. Howlongtobeat.com puts the Main Story of the game at 28 hours  with a 79 hours completionist time - a very decent amount of gameplay.

I think the best thing about the game right now for me is the seasonal events, as of writing this there is a Halloween event which makes the whole game feel so incredibly cozy, and you can turn off seasonal events if that isn't your thing!

Overall this game is like Animal Crossing and Pokemon had a very.. very strange child that is cozy and fun to play. I can't say why I keep coming back to this game, there is tons to do from collecting ooblets, to farming, running your own store, doing the halloween event.. etc.. it is endless and I keep telling myself 'oh I will just do x' and before finding myself playing hours later! Currently the game is at 40% off and at this price i recommend it 10000%, it's just a really unique game that stands out in the crowd of 'cozy' games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134851160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1697839041}
review:
Ever had that feeling you just couldn't find /that/ one game? Where.. uh.. everything just kinda feels off, or feels the same?

For me, this game successfully filled some kind of void I've been feeling lately with a lot of other games from the same/different genres. It sparked something amazing that other games couldn't. I give it a 10/10!

The only con is the repetitive music, but the fix is super easy: just turn off the ingame music volume and start your own playlist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198844125598', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1696767180}
review: I was excited for this game.. however, I didn't like the dialogue, gameplay and esp the music so I returned it..

author: {'steamid': '76561198051893645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1697432398}
review:
Dance Battle monster collector with easy enough farming mechanics!

TLDR; It's silly, fun, calming and easy. Slow to start and doesn't have deep mechanics you need to worry about mastering (from what I've experienced so far). OST is a banger. Managing Ooblets is pretty annoying, especially as a collector, you run out of space fast, and swapping them between your team, your farm and the Wildlands is cumbersome.

Positives:

I would consider farming games and card games an over saturated market in recent years for the indie scene. For me, a mixture of the great use of what feels like the entire color spectrum, silly and simplistic Ooblet designs, and NPCs that feel outright unnatural (which I am considering a good thing) while being sassy or quirky make this game stand out. 

I really enjoy that the NPCs are asshats along with their dry humor; everyone wears their personality on their sleeve, actively making fun of you or other NPCs or simply being the weirdest/quirkiest they can be. I would note that I usually hate quirkiness, as I don't find it very charming or cute, but the dry humor of the game offsets it that I still enjoy my time with that aspect. 

Possibly most importantly, the tracks in the game are absolute jams. I love getting into dance battles just to be able to hear all the songs often as I can, and I most certainly listen to the OST out and about. The dance battles themselves are fine! I don't really find myself having to think very hard about it; they're easy and simple, I usually just go into them using whatever ooblets are low level to get them leveled up. I've lost a couple dances, but nothing major.

Negatives: 

What has frustrated me most so far is managing Ooblets.

If I have a full 8 Ooblets following me you can always send one of your Ooblets home. What's obnoxious is that you can't simply call an Ooblet to your team from the menu. You have to physically find the one you want while it's wandering on your farm, among the rocks, branches, weeds, coops, stations and crops which can be very difficult based on their size, shapes or colors. 

It simply doesn't make sense to me that I can tell my Ooblet to head back to the farm from the menu, and they know exactly where to go, but I can't call the Ooblet back to me from the menu, ESPECIALLY if I am already on the farm.

Transferring Ooblets between the Wildlands, farm and team is also pretty tedious and from what I've seen, you cannot get rid of an ooblet permanently in any way, so the list that gets sent to the Wildlands grows very long when you don't have space on the farm or simply don't want some, which makes organizing a horrible hastle.

So in all, my only issue is with tedious design choices with managing Ooblets.

author: {'steamid': '76561199122163690', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1701917722}
review: Absolutely obsessed with how adorable the wee baby Ooblets are. This game gives so much serotonin simply for the cute creatures and silly sounds and the ultra cute way of speaking the NPCs have. The dance battles are the cutest way of creature collecting I've seen yet and I just want to find more and more Oob friends! As a bonus, the current Halloween event happening at the time of my comment is EVERYTHING to me. The devs did an amazing job at every little detail and I couldn't be happier as a Halloween enjoyer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017976098', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1708254749}
review:
This game is just fun, literally thats all it is. It does have some pacing problems at the start and does require a bit of learning on what to do/where to go (but hey, stardew was exactly the same) otherwise. it's just a really. really, really fun game to jump into. 

The writing is...odd, the music is great, runs really well, loads of stuff to do, grow and collect (love the stickers idea!). 

If you're not looking for a serious game then honestly this is a steal if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053617928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1698719230}
review: This game to me is essentially Pikmin trapped in Stardew Valley in the style of Adventure Time. At times the dialogue can feel a little 'hello fellow kids', but overall it's a really fun game. It checks all my boxes for addicting gameplay loop, the kind that makes me lose track of time because I hit the 'just one more day' mode and suddenly it's 4am. The graphics are cute, even if there aren't many character creation options (minimal hair/skin colors and no eye colors) and you forget how your character looks pretty quickly under all the clothes you buy or the customizations of the little critters you tame. The pacing is good and there's always something to do, so if you Liked Pikmin but thought it was way too stressful, this has the Pokemon grind but much more at your own pace. It even had Pokemon shinies, though they are supposed to appear at a higher rate. At almost 24 hours in I've only seen one, but that doesn't mean others hadn't spawned in areas I couldn't get to yet. Highly recommend because I'm having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254694636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1703634492}
review:
This game is really charming. 

Me - hasn't played any version or know anything really about Ooblets prior to the steam release had a tough time choosing between two cozy games and mainly because of the reviews. The other game Mineko's Night Market had a lot of reviews where people have played hours and hours of it already. Where I found for the Ooblets reviews that they are mostly from people who have already played it on the switch and they haven't racked up those steam hours.

I took into account the pricing... how Ooblets is 40% off right now and that counts for something right? buy it now so i don't have to buy it at full price later. Wow!! This game is super jam packed and i do not regret buying it. Very easy on the eyes unlike other games. I love that you aren't forced to keep cows and sheep and then tend to them for materials whilst doing everything else. The gathering xp based on how much you do during the day is great; makes me look forward to how many points i can accumulate the next day to see if i can level up.

Overall great game!! Sure others have complained about hip phrases or spelling but that's part of the charm. the Dance battles being implemented in place of trainer battles make the game so much fun and less worrying (maybe it's just me that gets antsy about losing when it's Pokemon battles)

review: I have about 210 hours on the Switch version, but I loved this game so much I had to play it on pc. The vocabulary used throughout the game is beautiful, all the ooblets are beautiful, and the way the game hypnotizes you into an endless loop of gameplay is flawless. This franchise deserves all the money so the developers can give us more content, I canâ€™t wait to see how the game grows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196913237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1699141506}
review: I've had this on my wish list for years since the developer first got the steam page and it was so worth the wait! Really fun crafting and "battle" mechanic, which is actually dance offs, totally cute. Only downside is there's so much to do I get distracted and craft things I needed the materials to upgrade something else lol.

review: got Happy Good autistic stimulation and started crying 5 mins in bc i ws so excited to finally b playing ooblets . pacing of the game is very nice (im playing w day speed on "relaxed") n i dont feel like i need to rush arnd completing tasks to avoid a consequence. ez gameplay to pick up and get used to and jus so comforting <3 ooblets you will ALWAYS be famous to me

author: {'steamid': '76561198320389895', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1697873878}
review: I bought this game when it originally came out on epic games, and i'll admit i didn't play it because i don't really enjoy the epic games experience. I have now bought it on steam and i am very much enjoying what i have played! the gameplay is simple yet engaging, you can grow lil buddies, decorate your home and character and interact + build friendships. Its cozy and thats what i am loving the most! I know there is a debacle with how the devs have treated steam players, but after some research ive found that it may come down to a dry sense of humour on their behalf. Of course things can always be handled better, but i think this game is so fun im kinda happy to overlook that negativity. I think if you're willing to give it a go grab it now while its on sale! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057129153', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1702949187}
review: I adore this game!! I've already played hours of it on the Switch and I got so excited when I saw it finally came to Steam so I could support it once again! It's bursting with so much charm and personality, and both the dance battles and farming are so fun and engaging. The Ooblets are adorable and the art style is very cool and relaxing to look at. Definitely give it a go if you're looking for a fun new cozy game.

review:
Played it for about 80 hours on Epic, got all the shiny ooblets, whatever they're called, comfortably in that time. I haven't seen how the steam port fairs, how the achievements are, and how the respawn rate and scaling has changed since full launch

BUT for what I remember, Ooblets is a delightful game and I enjoyed it to the point I bought it for Â£30 on epic, and then Â£15 on here, so yes, it is very much value for money and worth the price. If you like cosy games, this one is charming.

Edit: Update because I nominated it in the steam awards for the sit back and relax awards and it says to update a review for a nominee

author: {'steamid': '76561198041467342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1698886418}
review:
got this game 2 days ago and i've already played for 14 hours. don't buy this game.

JUST KIDDING. this game is fantastic! i usually find myself getting easily overwhelmed/falling behind when trying to play most other farming sims, but Ooblets hits that nice sweet spot between "too easy" and "too labor intensive." i love being able to dress up my character, my ooblets, and decorate my house! the aesthetic of this game is charmingly low-poly and outrageously cute. every new person, object, or creature i encounter continues to delight me to no end.

i'm definitely going to continue playing this for a good, long while

author: {'steamid': '76561198075753467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1699823761}
review:
A quick review from a farm-sims veteran.

This game is the perfect combination of best parts from games like Pokemon, Animal Crossing and Stardew Valley. You can tell that it was inspired by these classic but the devs somehow made this game its own thing. Dance battles are super fun and theres always so much to do. Completionists will spend many hours in this game catching every ooblet type.

This could honestly be one of the most relaxing and funny games I've ever played. Absolutely loving the atmosphere, the humor and the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066079985', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1698718423}
review:
I might return to this review for revisions as I continue the game, but I feel like I need to express my thoughts on this game as is. This is going to completely disregard the entire EGS fiasco.

Ooblets is a casual farm-sim, creature collector, deck building game. The game-play cycle revolves around you challenging ooblets to dance battles, which are basically simplified versions of typical card-battle games like hearthstone. Winning a battle nets you a seed that you can take to your farm to grow a new Ooblet. That's the core game play. 

I think the largest issue the game faces is how unbelievably slow the beginning of the game is. You're going to find yourself spending all of your money on seeds for your farm, and making back just enough to buy more seeds and maybe something else, if you're lucky. Everything you grow has some sort of in-game use, which typically is to feed to an ooblet to challenge them to a dance battle. You NEED the resources you grow in order to get more Ooblets or open new things in town, but, these plants are also supposed to be one of your main sources of income, either from the mission board or just selling them directly. It is a slog to get everything in Badgetown open, or expanding to new areas. The sense of progression is minimal, and it makes the game feel a lot more like busy work rather than a fun game. 

This game takes heavy inspiration from other life-sims like Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing. It doesn't try to hide that fact. it borrows many of its core elements from those games. However, those elements are watered down from their source material. There's a day/night system, but there isn't a season system or any sort of change in day-to-day life. You grow the same crops all the time, with the same ooblets, and any events are tied to the real-world calendar rather than an in-game one. Instead, the change in the daily-life comes through a level-up system, where new crops and ooblets appear as you gain XP. Leveling up is a slow process, meaning you're stuck with the same old same old for extended periods of time. It causes the game to feel very stagnate, rather than a living changing world like other life-sims. 

Characters. The characters in ooblets are completely unremarkable. Remember-able and unique NPCs are one of the foundational elements of a life-sim, and the characters in Ooblets are all too similar. There's a lack in dialogue variation, so many of the NPCs talk in the same way, and don't have much remarkable about their personalities. Even when doing introductions, I found myself unable to remember who it was I had just talked to. Many of these NPCs sort of just wander aimlessly around all day, lacking any sort of schedule aside from those who are also shopkeepers. With Badgetown also being very small, you'll wind up seeing them walking in circles or stuck on the geometry somewhere. The Ooblets themselves are the same. The player character is also a bit strange, as the character creator is barebones. Your character also has a voice, with the game already having quite a lot of dialogue for the player character, often breaking the immersion of you being a resident of this town. 

The game's art style is... okay. The biggest hindrance to it is that it's sort of generic. Everything looks so similar to one another, especially in regards to locations. I found myself trying to find a specific building in Badgetown, and going in 2-3 wrong ones every time. Ooblets themselves also look very same-y. There's not much interesting happening with the vast majority of them aside from trying to look cute and marketable. They all have the exact same animations that look like they were pulled from the unity store. Many of them are just an animal or a plant with silly eyes. The NPCs also have this issue with sharing too many animations. That and the game's programming often doesn't account for the outfits, environment, or anything the characters can hold, so these animations clip right through. The style of animation doesn't match the art style, really emphasizing  the "store-bought" feeling behind charcater movements. Especially when dance battles happen, which is what you're going to see the most of.

The elephant in the room is the game's writing. I mean the literal writing in the game. It tries so hard to be weird and quirky that it comes off as forced. None of the characters speak in a natural way, instead, talking like 2012 tumblr posts. The slang and abrupt attempts at humor just feel so commercial. There's no thought behind it. No attempt to craft an interesting world or even a fun story. it's just bland. I don't know how an indie studio managed to make all of their dialogue feel like a corporate attempt at being quirky. It makes me feel cynical, but it's just not cute or charming. The excessive use of vowels and baby-talk feels like they're trying to replicate Adventure Time slang but didn't understand how to. Others may feel differently, but seeing "Ok cool." at the top of the screen any time i pick up something new just makes me feel upset. It's bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058356904', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1698808775}
review:
Okay, let me summarise this in a very simple and concise way.

So take Animal Crossing and now mix it with Stardew Valley.
But instead of Stardew Valley it's actually Pokemon.
But actually plot twist it was actually Pikmin all along.
And instead of having Pokemon battles they have dance battles.
But instead of Pokemon battles done via dance it is actually Hearthstone. 

Oh yeah and everything and everyone was named by a 3 year old.

k thanks for reading now go buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199117278572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1704036164}
review:
There are a lot of things that I like and don't like about the game but still would recommend it. Maybe buy it whenever it is on sale. 

Pros:
-cute game/art/atmosphere
-music is calming
-never really run out of things to do

Cons:
-Slow paced/Takes a long time to level up
-Things cost gummies, which are pricey & can't obtain many of them in a day.
-I found out that I need to unlock the map in order to make certain recipes for the Halloween Event...this favors more of the players that have been playing since last year than the beginners starting out. 
-Crops are pricey and take forever to grow (the grind is real).
-The "time" of a day feels to go so quickly and My character lacks the energy to work the whole day....I have tried taking naps and eating to replenish my energy, but this is a joke. My energy bar doesn't fill up enough to justify the eating and napping. 


All in all, a good game, but could be better. Must have patience to play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199004519682', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1696986215}
review:
It's a very well made casual farming/life sim and the weirdest one I've ever played. It's also a creature collector and I enjoy that aspect as well. It's also a card battler with good mechanics, even though nobody gets hurt in the dance-offs. 

I bought this game having fairly low expectations and have been pleasantly surprised. It's fun and it's strange. 

However, Ooblets has no replay value. Events are tied to real time instead of an in-game calendar which completely ruins the immersion because things like snow just happen randomly. There is a main quest line and by the time I finished it I had 100% achievements, a practically unbeatable team of Ooblets, all of the farm/house upgrades, all of the recipes and items from the stores and wishing well that are worth having, and more money than I would ever need. There are multiple areas you unlock during the quest line but all of them have way less to do than the main town and very little reason to visit them once you've completed the main quest there. 

I'm glad I bought Ooblets at a 40% discount because I don't think it's worth full price since the heavy hitters of the farm/life sim genre have far more to offer and some of the best are cheaper. Still, if you can pick it up on a good sale, Ooblets is a uniquely weird experience and it's worth a play through.

review:
I have about 55 hours on this game on my nintendo switch, and decided to purchase it a second time to play on my steam deck. It runs so good, and the loading times are much quicker than on switch. Excited to experience the game a second time.
The game is super cute, quirky and really fun to play. And the music and graphics are so good too. I really recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067593734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1698596452}
review:
Update: Almost 40 hours in and I still really love the game. The story was really good and I'm still finishing my house and ooblets collection!

--

I wish the character creation was better but apart from that, I'm really enjoying Ooblets! It makes me laugh with how silly the dialogue is, and I love how easy the controls are (using a controller not mouse and keyboard). Lots of silly bugs but nothing game breaking, if anything it kind of adds to how silly and cute the game aesthetic is. I can't be mad when I'm trying to accessorise my ooblet and he keeps twerking at me so I can't see his face with his new goofy glasses on.

review: I've played this game since day 1 on EGS, and it has to be one of my favorite games of all time. The atmosphere, the dialogue, the art style, everything is perfect. The card battling is fun and adds a lot of weight to your ooblet choices. The little costumes you can give your ooblets makes it even more perfect. My only complaint is that energy management is extremely rough early on, but it does get a lot better as you unlock things.

review: Garbage devs that took bribes in exchange for screwing over their own patreon supporters and then had a hissy fit when those supporters rightfully got angry that they were scammed. No one should support these people financially, no matter what product they put out, until they properly apologize and provide compensation for the people they screwed over (hint: that's not going to happen). I'm happy that the 30% cut that Steam gets will be taken out of their wallets when I refund this. These people know no morality, the only way to possibly teach them right from wrong is by affecting their wallets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051362575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1696606125}
review: Not for me. Days and weeks pass, but seasons and years do not. Meaning that although I've played countless days--since it is October in the real world, it is Halloween in the game. And it will continue to be Halloween, no matter how many days pass in-game, till mid-November. (And why mid-November? I'm already sick of it now, I can't imagine how I'll feel on like,  November 10). The game gives me a trapped feeling, and it makes me feel like I'm not progressing.
developer_response: Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™re not enjoying the Halloween event! For future reference, thereâ€™s a setting to turn off seasonal content like the Halloween/Winter/Spring events. If you go to settings > extras, there should be a toggle labeled â€œSeasonal Content:â€ which you can set to â€œoffâ€. I hope that helps!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087156746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1697093759}
review: Sometimes life is hard, and all we want to come home to is something cozy and familiar. For some that can be RPGs, Shooters, Puzzles, etc. But for many, there is nothing more heartwarming than a well done farm game! Being a new release, it can be tough to discern whether this is just any other farm simulator, but I personally am loving it and find it to be very unique in a sea of games to sort through. If you like cute goofy worlds, the world of Oob is one you should jump right into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117228547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1699329904}
review: Really fun game so far! I really enjoy the gameplay loop: dancing (aka card battles) with ooblets, then planting the seed for the ooblet, and growing the little guy to use on my team. One criticism I have is with the downtime you have between waiting for your crops to grow. Sometimes it can feel like there's nothing to do. Maybe I haven't progressed far enough to get more things to do, but it would be nice if there was just one more minigame to play that gives gummy currency as a reward.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999993437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1702420235}
review:
note: this review has nothing to do with the controversy, I will be judging the game on it's own merits alone. 

This is a very cute game, a little bit twee but I can forgive that. I can safely say I enjoy this game

The problem: this game is poorly balanced and all over the place. 

the actual game play is focused mostly on farming mechanics and gathering resources. I don't find myself using the ooblets a whole lot because my focus is mostly on trying to gather resources without running out of money. It is hard to retain a safe amount of money because often times essential materials like seeds are overly pricey and its hard for me to keep up with prices. 

Maybe I am just bad at this game,  but I feel like it needs a stronger focus and better re-balancing. 

Overall I think this game has a lot of potential if some of the core issues were to be fixed.


edit: turned off comments because I am tired of listening to you all argue. as far as i am concerned, both the gaming community and the developers are at fault and I just want to move on to the actual game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819331051', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1696675767}
review:
Already played this on the Switch and now on Steam Deck (runs very well out-of-the-box btw.)

This is such a cute, quirky and wholesome game. A unique mix of farming, creature collection, card (dance) battles and exploring. The NPCs are adorable and quirky and there is a good portion of humor in this game. 

The only negative thing is that you cannot go to bed early and "skip" days, really.

review: I bought it over on Epic, too, but I love the concept, so I want to support it here too. The little friends you can pick up are interesting and cute/cool, and the dance battles are a very interesting take on the combat portion of these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026880545', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1710293611}
review:
Edit after 11 hours: I still recommend the game, but I must say that the silly writing is really becoming tedious.  The struggle for resources early on was a true pain and my love for the game has dwindled a bit.  It's still a mostly pleasant experience, but not as endearing as it was at first.  The creature collection aspect is the most fun, but, again, collecting the resources to challenge the creatures can be frustrating.  The dance battles are the most disappointing part for me, as there is no real "deck building" to this game.  You are given random cards based on the level/species of your Ooblets.  I've yet to have a challenging battle.  Hopefully that will change the further I progress.  Thus far, frankly, every thing but resource gathering has been too easy (I've unlocked the third location), with friendship progressing so routinely, battles always being won, and no challenge to quests other than the grinding of farming for resources to use and sell.   

Original review after one hour:  I don't usually review after such a short time, but I am absolutely in love with this charming game.  The graphics are lovely, the play is so pleasant, and though the silly language is, well, silly, the atmosphere is still pleasingly cozy.  One of the best features is that holiday/events can be turned off in the settings.  I'll definitely update this if I change my mind or if I make new discoveries that need to be highlighted, but for now, it's a keeper for me.

review: I bought this game originally on Epic Games, and loved it so much I decided to buy it again when it released on Steam. It's a perfect mix of cozy style gaming - cute graphics, delightful character designs and sounds, boppin' music, and it's so full of charm. The gameplay is fun, too. Your little ooblets have dance battles... which ofc immediately made me fall in love with the game. You can grow your little ooblets via seeds you win from dance battles, and omg I love my little Tud guy so much. He's too cute. His name is Spudd. Would recommend this game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198379845052', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1706439289}
review:
I fell in love with this game on the Switch, and now its finally released on Steam, I can safely say just as good if not better. 

You farm silly crops to make silly things for sale or for your little silly pets and you do little silly dance battles and explore silly little areas in a silly little land while making silly little friends. It's so perfectly light-hearted and goofy and fun. 

You never really consider the deep lore implications of things but you could if you wanted to; [spoiler] about a post-apocalyptic world being corrupted by toxic capitalists controlling everything and destroying ecosystems and towns on the way [/spoiler] - but you don't have to, and the game is still just whimsy goofy fun.

10/10. Shrumbo is best boy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992062972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1704044603}
review:
This game is beautiful, extremely polished and has a visual style that is incomparable to other games. It also has a sense of humour that I also just really dig. Definitely a fun one that I am looking forward to enjoying for many, many hours. It's cozy, delightful and shows a lot of love and constant updates.

People thinking about buying this shouldn't get dragged into the controversy. I've read through the entire thing, done my research, and everyone acted badly. I am not going to blame an indie dev for taking money to help make their product in order to be able to see their dream realised. I am not going to blame a dev who is self-aware that he acted badly and admitted they could have done better.

I do blame a horrible, toxic fanbase who brigaded someone three years ago for entitlement, and went so far as to fabricate fake evidence against the dev just to drum up more hate, and I do blame the same people for not being levelheaded about certain situations and cherrypicking things to attack others with due to personal grievances.

In my personal opinion, it was a bad situation all over and there are no heroes here, but the dev was the only one of the two parties who has moved on and has learned from it.

And the game is a great show of what people can do through adversity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101127971', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1697067073}
review:
I've been waiting for this game to be on steam since 2017. Played a couple hours so far. I wish I could say I was in love with it because I'd been so interested in it for so long, but I can only say it's alright. Sometimes it feels like the devs tried too hard or something? It's hard to put my finger on it. I feel like it's the lingo they use, replacing so many simple words with silly versions. Some of it's cute. Some of it could be reeled back a bit. I realize I'm probably being picky. I'm also not a big fan of the noises characters make when you interact with them.

Other than that, I love the cute little guys and that I can grow them! I don't understand the Halloween event, but I'm hoping to because I love Halloween. I just have no idea how to get candy corn? Looking forward to all the clothes and furniture I can buy as well, I hope there's a big selection because I love that kind of thing in games. I'd been curious how the dance battles work as well and was pleasantly surprised you draw cards to take actions basically. It's a very cute minigame! I wish it was my new favorite game but at the same time, I appreciate that they're doing something different with these funky little dudes. Hopefully it grows on me as I play more!

review: Very fun and cozy game Iâ€™ve been addicted to it for the past 24 hours! I love games that lets you collect things and you can collect a lot in this one! The music is so cute and quirky and I always appreciate and can tell when devs really care about how the music sounds. Graphics are amazing and the Halloween theme is so adorable! The only thing I wish is for my inventory to have a little sorting button as I found myself having to move things by hand. Other than that Iâ€™m enjoying the mystery aspect with those pesky cans around town and of course getting into dance battles with my Ooblets!

author: {'steamid': '76561199083770316', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1699066366}
review:
I played this game for the first time on my switch, after getting it i fell in love with absolutely everything about it. i had to go on a camping trip after getting it, and by god i played it the whole time. whenever i would play it in the garage my father would ask me all kinds of questions and when i explained things he would reply with "none of those are words." I talked about ooblets to every single person i know for months, and have been again since they announced the steam release. I wrote the release day on the calendar in my kitchen and showed it to my mom like a proud child. 

kind of just rambling, but this game means a lot to me. if you're thinking about getting it, god damn it buy it right now. it'll be the best purchase you've ever made

author: {'steamid': '76561197992297217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1696565374}
review:
The devs need a chill pill. They have an abusive, childish resentment of significant portions of their community, many of which supported them financially through Patreon.

I'm not sure I'll be able to buy another game from them in the future, after seeing so many examples of their poor attitudes when dealing with any level of adversity or differing opinions. A Dev/Consumer relationship is symbiotic, and should be handled respectfully.

Feel free to research and evaluate the Ooblets controversy for yourselves, before purchasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153618987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1696964119}
review:
I remember when I put this game on my wishlist. It was a simpler time, I was only a boy. 

Though the years have hardened me I still held out hope that one day this game would finally make it to Steam. Many times I thought I had given up hope. Imagine my surprise to find a random email saying this game had been not only released on Steam but also was 40% off. 

A flood of emotion returned. Nostalgia, longing, excitement, and pure joy as I booted up the game. I was met with quirky humor and derpy Ooblets, everything I had been waiting all this time for.

Anyway, game is good. The wait was long. Glad to finally play Ooblets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001843103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1696550447}
review:
I bought this game on Epic and love it. I bought this game on the Switch for my daughter and she loves it. I've now bought it on Steam and look forward to loving it again. 

To the negative comments using old out of context quotes from the developer, do your own research into a years old (like 2019) controversy. If you don't want to go digging, you can also read all about it here:
https://www.pcinvasion.com/ooblets-the-story-so-far-whats-with-the-outrage-and-fake-screenshots/

These are good people making a silly fun game. I supported them then and still support them now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046893258', 'num_games_owned': 2917, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 2893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1697340558}
review:
Really fun game! An addictive combo of all my favorite games in one! Pokemon meets Animal Crossing to simplify it.
Not a single player girlie usually, and while I do hope they add multiplayer in the future, i've been having fun even myself.
Good game, will be playin' much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256430160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1697108795}
review:
This game IS AMAZING! â™¥
I'm not quite sure where the nay-saying and "blood in the water" style grudges are coming from but as a person who has logged over 15 hours already here on Stream and a good 50-60 more on the Switch version, I can promise you this game is fantastic!

It may be a bit quirky for some people but personally? I adore the quirkiness so much! 
The colour palette's, creature designs, sound design, the music and just overall premise are amazing and for its current launch price its honestly a steal. (The game at normal price is also definitely worth it!)

There is a form of shiny hunting called gleamies and PLENTY of replayability if you're an avid enjoyer of games in this genre. Honestly, everyone is obviously entitled to their own opinion but for myself and many of my friends and fellow community members? This game is 1000% worth a purchase and the Devs deserve all sorts of love, support and praise! They have been nothing but sweet, kind and genuine in any form of contact I have had with them personally or seen in their community.

Give 'em ALL love and wishlists if you're even slightly interested! â™¥â™¥

review: Out of all the squinkles in the west, this is one of the squinkliest.  It's chock full of bagrumblies and hankletanks, with lots of sherblumplers to grab.  You boogie 'till your booty falls off, and pick up them there scragglits while your at it.  Would cranklert again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088434621', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1697652152}
review:
I have been playing this game on other platforms since it released, and I always find it fun to dive back into. The music is comforting with its own little funky touches, a theme you'll notice throughout the game. It's super fun to catch all the little Ooblets in dance battles, and I am always amused at what my new neighbors have to say each day. 
The Halloween event is also super adorable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263332948', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1696534178}
review: My husband surprised me with this game as soon as it came out, and I am already in love. This is a very fun game! I cannot believe it was made by two people. There are a ton of fun mechanics, way more than I thought there would be. The graphics are cute, the creatures are adorable, and aesthetic is super comfy. Get the game, support the devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198982668356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1711936027}
review:
Great game. Best game. I used to play it a lot on Epic Games, but that was years ago and I have been waiting for it to come out on Steam. Amazing music, just the cutest vibes, (Like genuinely so cute) and there are low stakes so I don't feel pressured to remember everything when I come back to play. It's like a mix of a farming sim and Pokemon. I love it! I absolutely 1000% recommend!
P.S: The stuffies are amazing. I got Shrumbo and Glanter and I am actually literally obsessed with them. They even come with tags of the food that they need to be caught with and my glanter is so soft and squishy. I extremely genuinely love them. I didn't buy the Clomper b/c I feel like the dimensions are weird? But the other two I totally recommend as well.

"While some of what Iâ€™ve said was definitely bad for PR, I stand behind it. A portion of the gaming community is indeed horrendously toxic, entitled, immature, irrationally-angry, and prone to joining hate mobs over any inconsequential issue they can cook up. That was proven again through this entire experience."

-Ooblets devs after going Epic Games Store exclusive

author: {'steamid': '76561197974116888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1696534004}
review: The writing and tone will not be for everyone (I love it personally - _most_ games fumble the bag when trying out something tonally unique like this - Ooblets nails it IMO) - however the core gameplay loop is so solid that I think anyone could get a kick out of it. I spent a good chunk of time on Switch - but having tested it out on the Steam Deck for a bit I can safely say it'll be my platform of choice going forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213314681', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1697335534}
review:
I have played the game since early access when it still was exclusive to the Epic Launcher, and now that its finally here on steam, on its full release (with potentially more content coming?) for me it is a 500%, awesome, silly little goober game, its a perfect game to relax after a hard day at work and watch your little creatures dance to their hearts content and help you farm. So of coarse being the gremlin that i am for silly little goobers i bought the game for a second time. It has silly and creative characters, great humor, a story i have yet to peice together, and silly and cute little creatures that likes to dance :)
If i would estimate my game time on the epic launcher, it would be around 100 hours, total on multiple saves.
With this? even more. 

So TLDR if you like
-farming
-a nicely paced game
-silly and cute creatures
-turn based card "battle" (dancing)
-seasonal events (cosmetics n fun stuff)
-a very pleasant art style
-fun npcs
Then you will also 500% enjoy the game as much as i do!
----
edit: You will enjoy this game!! Alot!! I may just have accidentally speedran the story, but it doesnt mean im gonna stop! Gonna finish EVERYTHING the game has to offer! God i love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198830362929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1696526078}
review:
I think I would love this game if it didn't feel like it was made by a group of 30 year olds that are trying their absolute hardest to be quirky and random and "little uwu Tumblr gremlins" yknow. Maybe I'm just boring but it feels like the wacky zany super random humour is really forced and way too over the top.

I will say that the art style and soundtrack are really cute and I do love the concept! Maybe if I never interact with any characters I'll be able to play the game a bit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202982067', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1705464286}
review:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS GAME SO MUCH WITH MY WHOLE HEART!
I have been already playing it on Epic, but I'm delighted to have it on Steam. Starting all over again has the excellent perk of reading all the starting dialogues I've already forgot about. This game's tired but wholesome millenial humor speaks directly to my soul. Every dialogue is pure magic and make me giggle like the first time I've read them.
THE OST! I've repeatedly found myself humming the songs while doing dishes or waiting for the bus.
THE OOBZ! I LOVE THEM and with a friend we realized the [u]ultimate end game[/u] is finding the perfect accesories for each Ooblet. I've already found the rain hat is S+ for Plob. S++ with round glasses. And the dance battles have depth and eventually gain more complexity! You have to dance along your Oob to understand what they want to do. My Tud always wants to gain hype. No points, only hype. And I respect them.
HAVING A FARM! Tending it and decorating your house is one of my favorite experiences on games (as a general), and it's beautifully implemented here.
THE WORLD BUILDING! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

As a lifelong Frunbuns I've made fanart of Tud and the team gifted! me! a key! of the game!
I'm shocked and grateful and screaming to all my friends about it. I love this game, it's perfect ğŸ’œ

Edit at 22 hours: I CAN'T STOP PLAYING, I NEED ALL THE OOBZ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064972820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1706922823}
review:
Quick Note: I have played Ooblets previously (many, many hours), and this is my sincere review of my love for this game. I hope this helps new players make a decision. I am also a casual player and enjoy many cozy titles.

Dailyo!!
Ooblets is a fun, cute, silly game that is charming and a real joy to play. I love this game with my whole being and I still regularly play often!
It is one of the few indie titles that joins two of my favorite genres: monster taming and farm sims.

It has all the wonderful qualities of a farm sim: farming, friendships, customization, home customization, cooking and some crafting.
Ooblets has put a fun twist on battling. Instead of the usual battles we're used to in monster tamers, our Ooblet critters enjoy Dance Battles in the form of turn-based card battles and aren't afraid to show off their slick moves. This makes battling a bit less competitive, more casual and fun which I think proves a wonderful introduction to folks who haven't played monster tamers before. (And also means the battles tracks are so DAMN good)
The dialogues between your townsfolk are silly and funny; it makes engaging with them feel rewarding and so much fun that I think cozy gamers will really appreciate. The story is also a fun ride and Ooblets holiday events are seriously the best events I've ever experienced in a cozy game.

I have so much to say, but there is so much packed into Ooblets that I would rather not share so that new players can experience this game blind and truly enjoy what this game offers!
The Devs put SO MUCH love into this game and I am so happy to see how Ooblets is doing today.
Thank you so much to the Devs for making Ooblets happen and continuously giving us more content. I'll happily follow and support you in any future project(s) you pursu!. 

And with that, I wish everyone a grand journey in the land of Oob, where you heard fabled tales of oddity, creativity, and Ooblets!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046368288', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1704605943}
review:
[i]Preface: I have about 45 hours in Ooblets on Switch (3/4 through story), which is a great platform for this game but also I am excited to go from 10 second loading screens to 2 second loading screens![/i]

I've often looked for my "holy grail" casual game - ie. a game I can pick up when I only have time to play for an hour and still feel satisfied, a game that I can put down for 3 months and come back to later without feeling lost and unsure of what I had been doing, a game that is relaxing and lets me set my own goals. Ooblets, more than any other cozy game I've played, is exactly that for me.

While there is a day-night cycle, I don't feel the same time pressure in Ooblets to complete [i]everything[/i] in one day that I do when playing Stardew Valley and I'm not trying to constantly min-max my profits; I generally have goals in mind (make money, collect all the furniture and clothes, maybe someday fill out the almanac with every ooblet) but within each game day, I do whatever I feel like doing! This makes it very low stress to put the game down for a while - I know when I pick it up again, all I have to do is toodle around and I'll start vibing with the game again.

Ooblets has a [i]lot[/i] of (well-designed) systems and little mini-games that integrate well together. Farming is in service of making currency, but is also necessary for catching a good amount of ooblets, and for cooking food that boosts your energy or used as gifts for the villager friends. Catching ooblets fills out your collection, provides you with helpers for your farm, and adds some strategy to your card selection for dance battles. Making printed models of ooblets might sound like a little throw-away mechanic, but maybe you want to fill out the museum displays in the town hall, or sell them in your player shop when they're in demand for extra cash. Sea dangling (aka fishing) is probably the mechanic I've engaged least in, but it provides useful resources and items to sell in your player shop. There's also mini-games, like a slider puzzle mini-game and actual arcade games, that are fun diversions. All of these various systems and the collection-oriented nature of Ooblets means that even when only playing for a short time, there's plenty of satisfaction in moving goals forward.

In thinking about what makes Ooblets engaging for me, I also have to highlight the wonderful character writing. While the villagers you can make friends with don't exactly [i]change[/i] their nature over time, they'll reveal more of their thoughts, emotions, and backstory the higher friendship you get. Even better, the [b]quantity[/b] of dialogue is so much greater than Stardew Valley, much less Animal Crossing - I've maxed out a character's friendships stickers and started worrying I'd start getting the same daily dialogue, but instead one day they casually dropped a piece of backstory I hadn't heard before and made me go "ohhhh" about their character. I can't emphasize how much hearing new dialogue lines from characters even so many hours into the game sets Ooblets apart from other games where chatting with villagers becomes a chore because of the repetitive dialogue.

My biggest (and basically only?) critique of the game is that there's roughly 3 music tracks that play in Badgetown and they get super repetitive, super quick. I'd love some kind of "town audio" vs "battle music audio" slider so that I could mute the town music but still enjoy the dance battle music (but also being on PC I'll probably just go mute the Badgetown audio tracks in Audacity so I can still enjoy the other areas' music).
