author: {'steamid': '76561198141484913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1699676810}
review:
I cannot express my love for this adorable, nonsensical game enough. I have over 60 hours on Nintendo Switch, and I bought it INSTANTLY when it came out on Steam. I cannot wait to sit down and grow my sweetbeeties and make some treabies for my lil dancing babies all over again.
Edit: Just to show you I mean it, I'm already 37 hours into this save.

Already, this game looks really great on PC. It controls pretty smoothly, though I might still connect a controller, because I really like how it controls on Switch. So far, I haven't experienced any stutters, and I've noticed a ton of new accessories and decorations, so I'm super excited to find them all.

The best thing about this game is how much fun it is to just relax and vibe with its silly little world. The music is awesome, the characters are adorable, and the language--while it might take some time to get used to--is hilarious. It always brings a smile to my face, and its on the top of my list of favorite games, right next to Stardew. 

The gameplay isn't complicated, but it stays fun as things get more hectic. Some dance battles can be challenging, but its not like 4D chess or anything. Shiny hunting is also very doable, I have quite a few on my Nintendo Switch save. I really like that they don't make finding new Ooblets or shinies a horrible grind. Seasonal content is also quite fun, and since its spooky season, now is the time to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996567527', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1705186685}
review:
I've put several hundred hours into this game on another platform before it came to Steam, and I look forward to playing it more here as well.

Ooblets is a very cute and charming game with memorable characters and silly dialogue. There are lots of adorable creatures to befriend and collect, as well as a farm, home, and shop for you to expand, improve, and decorate however you want. You can travel to different regions of the world, each with their own unique setting and theme. There are also seasonal events that inject some fresh and exciting activities that will keep you coming back every few months, even if you haven't played in a while.

Ooblets appeals to casual players and dedicated spreadsheet optimization folks alike. You can play at your own pace, and there are no consequences for doing anything "too slowly."

This game is one that you can play for hours on end, but it is also easy to pick up and put down if you only have brief windows of time -- making it an excellent game to play on the go if you happen to have a Steam Deck.

The community surrounding this game has been very friendly, positive, and rewarding to be a part of. The devs have been releasing free content updates several times per year since the game launched, and there are even more new features on the way.

I have found it to be worth every penny at full price, and if you can get this game on sale, I consider it a no-brainer.

Lastly, Nuppo is the best boy; may you all receive the blessing of many Nuppo spawns!

author: {'steamid': '76561199471945737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1697324272}
review:
Ooblets is the perfect game for folks who like adorable shenanigans, achievable challenges, and witty NPCs. I'm constantly laughing out loud along with the snarky townies or getting that hit of joy when I forage a good collectable. 

I loved playing this on the old platform and am SO excited it's on Steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122687829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1701363162}
review: I've been a huge fan of farming sims, card battlers, and monster collector games so getting a game that has all of those made me feel like I were Gollum on the 5th day of Christmas. The game is very relaxing (no training/breeding for stats is a huge plus for me). The devs constantly add free contents like mini-games, new monsters, events, and other fun collectibles. And if you want to see all of those, you can check them out on the wiki or the guide (rumored to be made by a good-looking fella). I also recommend joining the official Discord server. It has an active community and even the devs regularly chat there. This game is one of the reasons why I installed EGS years ago and I gotta say, after 600+ hours of playtime, the game is worth much more than what you pay for it.
